The North Holland Peninsula can be divided in three regions. The most urbanized region is
) with about 308,000 inhabitants. It is a weakly defined region with no definitive name and overlaps with other regions. Some proposed names for this region include
, although only a small part of the region actually is a part of West-Friesland and it has no connection with the historical county of Kennemerland.
is a culturally distinct area encircled by the
. The West Frisian dialect belongs to the Hollandic dialect group of the Dutch language, but it is related to the West Frisian language as spoken in the province of
, a sparse region outside of the dike where West Frisian is also spoken. The island of
is culturally a part of this region, but geographically an island in the Wadden Sea.
The Hollandic Dutch dialect of West Frisian is spoken in West Friesland and the Kop van Noord-Holland. This is not to be confused with the language of West Frisian as spoken in the province of
, even though both languages are related to each other.
